contents:
I suggest anyone interested in acquiring a language to use it everyday for the very purpose you would like your language to satisfy, such as watching a movie without subtitles, playing a game without checking your dictionary, writing some articles discussing about a philosophical topic you do some reflection upon, or speaking without resorting to you mother tongue first.

Without a lot of comprehensive imitation one can never acquire a language, for men can only truly develop capacity for a language as a child does through imitation and repeating, while at the same time really understanding what you're doing.

Forget shits like grammar, syntax, morphology, cultural details, or memorizing words and phrases which are only valuable for alien creatures rather than humans. IELTS branded or not, they are Pure waste of time.
